Material used.Description: Human a-Syn cDNAs (wild-type, mutant A53T, mutant A30P, and double mutant A53T/A30P) were overexpressed in Escherichia coli BL21 (DE3).

Readout description.Result Description: A30P a-Synuclein does not bind to POPC/bPS vesicles and fails to undergo conformational transition from random coil to a-helical structure.
A53T a-Synuclein binds to POPC/bPS vesicles and undergoes conformational transition similar to wild-type a-Synuclein.
Double mutant A53T/A30P a-Synuclein does not bind to POPC/bPS vesicles and fails to undergo conformational transition, similar to A30P.

Technical replicates.Description: Three scans per sample were averaged for CD spectroscopy.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-Synuclein was used as a positive control for membrane binding.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: CD values at 222 nm from three to four separate experiments were averaged, and standard deviations were indicated.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Increased ellipticity at 222 nm indicating a-helical conformation upon binding to vesicles.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: No significant change in ellipticity at 222 nm, indicating failure to transition to a-helical conformation.

Material used.Description: Brain PE/brain PS (1:1 w/w) MLVs were mixed with either wild-type or A30P a-Synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: Barely detectable levels of A30P a-Synuclein were found in the membrane pellet, indicating significantly impaired binding.
Not specifically tested in ultracentrifugation experiments in the provided text.
Not specifically tested in ultracentrifugation experiments in the provided text.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-Synuclein was used as a positive control for membrane binding.

Basic negative control.Description: Wild-type a-Synuclein ultracentrifuged in the absence of MLVs served as a control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Significant presence of a-Synuclein in the membrane pellet indicating binding.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Minimal or no presence of a-Synuclein in the membrane pellet indicating impaired binding.

Material used.Description: MLVs of bPE/bPS were used with wild-type or A30P a-Synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P a-Synuclein did not significantly alter the repeat spacing of lipid bilayers, indicating defective binding.
Not specifically tested in X-ray diffraction experiments in the provided text.
Not specifically tested in X-ray diffraction experiments in the provided text.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-Synuclein was used as a positive control for altering repeat spacing in lipid bilayers.

Basic negative control.Description: Lipid bilayers in the absence of a-Synuclein served as a control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Significant increase in repeat spacing of lipid bilayers indicating binding.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: No significant change in repeat spacing of lipid bilayers indicating defective binding.
